@Rudy2828 That is true, but WaFD is not a REIT.  I hold many preferred stocks from companies that are not REITs and their dividends are recognized as qualified, for example Enbridge.

According to the IRS, REIT dividends are considered pass-through income, which means they are distributed to investors as ordinary income, not qualified dividends (Source: ‘What Are Qualified REIT Dividends?’ - 1031 Crowdfunding, January 23, 2024).
